epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 7, 799 Pacific Highway, Chatswood NSW 2067, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_producer_address: 309 / 2a Montrose Place, Hawthorn East Vic 3123, Australia
pcr: PCR 2012:01 Construction Products and Construction Services, Version 2.3, 2018-11-15
PCR 2012:01-SUB-PCR-G Concrete and concrete elements, version 2.3, 2018-11-22

product_description.product_name: Precast reinforced concrete box culverts and headwalls
product_description.manufacturer: Humes Concrete Products (Humes), division of Holcim (Australia) Pty Ltd
product_description.product_range: Box culverts, ballast kerbs, wing walls
product_description.product_use: Bridging for pedestrian, fauna and stock crossings under road and rail applications

product_characteristics.material: Reinforced concrete made from coarse and fine aggregates, cement, water, steel reinforcement, supplementary cementitious materials (SCM) such as fly ash, and chemical admixtures
product_characteristics.sizes: Small box culverts (600 mm to 1200 mm span), large box culverts (>1200 mm to 3000 mm span), heights 450 to 2400 mm, length 2400 mm
product_characteristics.load_classes: Railway load class 300LA, road load class SM1600
product_characteristics.wingwall_sizes: Manufactured to fit 450 to 2400 mm height range of culverts

product_description.hazardous_substances: None contained above 0.1% (m/m) as per European REACH regulation
product_description.dust_hazard: Dust classified as hazardous due to crystalline silica content; exposure through inhalation should be avoided

standards: AS 1597.1:2010 Precast reinforced concrete box culverts Part 1: Small culverts
AS 1597.2:2013 Precast reinforced concrete box culverts Part 2: Large culverts
RMS QA Specification R16 Precast Reinforced Concrete Box Culverts
AS 5100 & AS 1597 series requirements for design loads
technical_compliance.reference_service_life: 100 years when manufactured and installed according to standards

raw_materials_standards: AS/NZS 3972: General purpose and blended cements (2010)
AS 3582.1 Supplementary cementitious materials Part 1: Fly Ash (2016)
AS 2758.1 Aggregates and rock for engineering purposes Part 1: Concrete Aggregates (2014)
AS 1478 Chemical admixtures for concrete, mortar and grout (2000)
lca_information.transport: Raw materials transported via articulated trucks; impact based on specific supply sources for Tamworth
lca_information.manufacturing_process: Casting specially formulated Self Compacting Concrete (SCC) into reusable steel moulds, curing in controlled environment, outdoor curing, quality checks
background_data_sources: Primary data from Humes Tamworth factory FY19 (1 July 2018 - 30 June 2019)
Supplier EPD for reinforcing steel (OneSteel, registration S-P-00855)
lca_information.data_age: Background data less than 10 years old
lca_information.methodology: In line with EN 15804; deviations recorded
lca_information.averaging_method: Weighted average concrete composition and steel content per product group; six product groups defined by product type, application, and size

allocation_rules.fly_ash: Environmental impacts allocated to electricity; fly ash only burdened with transport
allocation_rules.steel_scrap: Recycling allocation follows polluter pays principle per EN 15804 and PCR

cut_off_criteria.packaging_materials: Estimated only due to low materiality

lca_information.key_assumptions: All SCC concrete included; weighted average composition used including <10% from neighbouring plant

transport_and_installation.transport: Raw materials transported to site via articulated trucks; product transport to installation site after manufacturing
transport_and_installation.installation: Minimal excavation and backfill required for culverts; suitable for difficult site conditions

carbon_emission_context.declared_unit: 1 tonne of precast reinforced concrete product manufactured in Tamworth (NSW) for infrastructure applications

environmental_indicators.abiotic_depletion_fossil_fuels: approx. 2.08E+03 to 2.97E+03 MJ net calorific value

variation.global_warming_potential: Â±10% for most products; some exceed +10% for POCP and ADPE
variation.other_indicators: Ranges provided with minimum and maximum variations per product group

recycled_materials_handling.steel_reinforcement: Recycling allocation follows polluter pays principle per EN 15804 and PCR; data sourced from supplier EPD
recycled_materials_handling.fly_ash: Environmental impacts allocated to electricity; fly ash only burdened with transport impacts

additional_info.safety_health_environment_management: Holcim executive committee monitors workplace safety and environmental protection; environmental risks identified and managed
additional_info.infrastructure_sustainability: Humes is member of Infrastructure Sustainability Council of Australia (ISCA); supports IS rating scheme for sustainable infrastructure
additional_info.previous_epd: 2016 EPD for reinforced concrete pipe products available at EPD Australasia website
